column1: At  this  juncture,  the  Court  is  reminded  of  the  observations  of  the  Court  of

column3: Jayaweera  V.  Asst.  Commissioner  Of  Agrarian  Services

column1: Ratnapura And Another13 where it was held that

column2: “A Petitioner who is seeking relief in an application for the issue of a Writ
of  Certiorari  is  not  entitled  to  relief  as  a  matter  of  course,  as  a  matter  of
right or as a matter of routine. Even if he is entitled to relief, still the Court
has  a  discretion  to  deny  him  relief  having  regard  to  his  conduct,  delay,
laches, waiver, submission to jurisdiction - are all valid impediments which
stand against the grant of relief.”

column1: For  the  foregoing  reasons,  I  am  of  the  view  that  the  Petitioners  have  failed  to
satisfy the requirements necessary to invoke the writ jurisdiction of this Court.
Accordingly, notice is refused. The application is dismissed. No costs.
